title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency programs. Grants will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations for research and awareness education on emergency preparedness and disaster response in urban and rural areas. The program aims to enhance disaster response awareness in disadvantaged urban and rural communities, especially in areas heavily affected by disasters. Eligible nonprofit organizations can receive grants to develop and promote emergency preparedness education programs tailored to these communities. An eligible nonprofit organization must be a 501(c)(3) organization focused on serving disadvantaged communities and have a partnership with a disadvantaged business enterprise to qualify for a grant under this program. The funds awarded can only be used for acquiring professional services for research in disadvantaged communities. The program awards grants to eligible nonprofit organizations partnering with disadvantaged business enterprises. Funds can be used for research in disadvantaged communities, developing informational materials on emergency preparedness, and collaborating with national organizations to disseminate information. The program aims to promote emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities by partnering with national organizations and institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. To be eligible for funding under this program, organizations must submit an application to the Director following specified procedures. Definitions include the term 'disadvantaged business enterprise' referring to a business enterprise. The Director requires applications for funding under the program, with definitions for 'disadvantaged business enterprise', 'disadvantaged community', 'disadvantaged individual', and 'HUBZone'. Definitions include socially or economically disadvantaged individuals and HUBZone as per the Small Business Act. Authorization of Appropriation for fiscal years 2004 through 2007 is provided.
